Audience
The men, women, and children
watching ety often respond, as in¬
dividuals or as groups.
One hind of response is the writ¬
ten letter. In commercial broad¬
casting, the accepted maxim is
“they only write when they don’t
like you.” In etv, the writing im¬
pulse is the reverse. The letters op¬
posite typify the reaction of
viewers to non-school program¬
ming by etv stations. The mail is so
one-sided, in fact, that some etv
station managers, while grateful,
refuse to put great store in it as a
measure. “Remember,” said one,
“they are seeking educational tele¬
vision as earnestly as etv is seeking
an audience. Once you find some¬
thing you’ve hungered for, your re¬
action is bound to be favorable.”

pressed in dollars and cents. Where
